availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George W. Aton (Hopkins County, KY, blacksmith, private 35th Ky Mtd Inf.)

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, blacksmith and soldier. Indiana native. Married to Priscilla Simon Aton in Hopkins County, Kentucky, on January 22, 1861. Father of William E. Aton, Annie B. Aton, and Charles H. Aton. Blacksmith in Madisonville in 1860. Served in the 35th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from October 2, 1863, to December 29, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Madisonville, p. 836.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, Wallers Precinct, p. 422B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994039, Hopkins County Marriages.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 365.
"George W. Aton (1838-1914)," Find A Grave, Memorial #151064683, accessed October 13, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/151064683.
